I have promised to give you some property. As per the promise made, for your development and for your livelihood, the property as per the schedule below has come into my possession as my ancestral property and I have been enjoying my full possession and right of possession since the date of coming into possession till today, including the R.C.C. Building etc. situated at Door No. 12-298/3 in Kothapet village, measuring 83.92 sq. m., without taking any kind of consideration from you, I hereby transfer to you the said property, namely, Rs. 9,46,000/- in literal form, worth nine lakhs and forty-six thousand rupees, free of charge and by executing this settlement deed, I hereby transfer the said property to you today itself. From now on, you should register the said property in your name in the records of the Sri Panchayat and pay all the taxes due to the Sri Panchayat, and you and your sons and grandsons and descendants should enjoy it happily, freely and develop it forever. Cognitive barriers Whatever disputes or disturbances arise from anyone, I will settle them all at my own expense and grant you, your heirs, and I and my heirs the right to enjoy the property in full and uninterruptedly according to this settlement deed. The said property is undisputed and unencumbered property, that there have been no other written agreements, contracts, guarantees, etc., in violation of this settlement deed, that the permit, survey number, ward number, boundaries, etc. included in this settlement deed are correct, that there are no other partners, male or female rights holders, except me, that there are no court cases, and that there are no bank debts, I have told you, convinced you, and made you believe, and I have written and given this settlement deed in your name. This property does not come under the ambit of Andhra Pradesh Ascendant Lands Act No. 9/1977. This property does not come under the ambit of Section 22-A of the APAMENDAMENTACT 19/2007. This property is not the property of the Government. This property is not a land grant property and this property does not come under the ambit of land ceiling.
Since the said property has an R.C.C. building bearing door no. 12-298/3, an 'M' notice is hereby filed.

Declaration: The property transferred by this document is R.C.C. I hereby confirm that there are no trees, plantations, precious minerals, mines, precious stone quarries, missionary, fish ponds, etc., other than the building, and I agree to be prosecuted and liable to pay the depreciation duty if any such factual details are found to have been concealed in this document in the future. This settlement deed is enforceable subject to the laws in force. KODUMB &

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 238 of 2026, dated 23-Jan-2026, executed by Kancharla Ramanareddy, in favour of his Wife, Kancharla Devi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 83.92 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 12-298/3, comprised in survey number 631, LP No. 2496, situated in Kothapeta Village and Gram Panchayat, Kothapeta Mandal, within the District of Konaseema, registered at sub-registrar office Ambajipet, is bounded as follows: North by: Panchayathi Road South by: House and site of Yarramsetti Tatayya East by: House and site of Sunkara Nagalakshmi West by: House and site of Bhimana Venkateswararao Note :Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note : It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
